As Singtel Networks transforms into a Digitalised Networks, cyber security has become ever more important. We are looking for fresh graduates to join us as Cyber Security Analyst / Engineer in the areas of governance, planning, or operations.

Cyber Security Governance
As the first level support for Cyber Security Governance for Singtel Networks, you will manage project coordination, governance and compliance reports, systems and control reviews, build awareness on cyber security and coordination of cyber security requirements for Networks.

Cyber Security Planning
As a Cybersecurity Planning Engineer for Group Security Engineering of Singtel Networks, you will be part of the team building new Cybersecurity platforms to provide centralized security services. Your role requires project planning, coordination and implementation of the security platforms protecting Critical Information Infrastructure across the Group Technology Network.

Cyber Security Operations
Under Cyber Security Operations, you will provide network and systems support to users and provide engineering support in a security operations center environment.

Softskills / Personal attributes:
Possess growth mindset, willing to take ownership.
Hands-on with ability to multi-task in a fast moving and rapidly changing environment.
Able to collaborate in a team to maximise teamwork and be empowered to work independently.
Willing to take ownership of assigned responsibilities and tasks.
Possess growth mindset and take initiatives to learn and grow.

Office administration

Issue and track laptops for staff and vendors regularly, liaising with Central PC team

Management support

Follow through with reimbursement of travel claims on his return

Ensure confidentiality in all matters dealt with
Execute monitoring of any system audit fraud and generate reports

Administration support
Validate and raise SO/SE for Agency contract monthly invoices

Any other admin work assigned from time to time.

Financial Support
Monitor both capex and opex expenditure and present status report to management upon request
Assist in the compilation of budget numbers during the annual budget exercise and input into BPC
Assist in reporting for up-to-date spending of each individual project and the detail information such as when POs, SOs raised when GRS & SE done etc
Assist in OPEX up-to-date spending and detail information such as when POs, SOs raised when GRS & SE done etc
Alert management for abnormalities
Assist in OPEX cost accrual submission each month within the given deadline
Familiar with SAP reports and transactions relating to Financial monitoring

Create New Capital Projects in SAP during AOP budgeting period

Provide eWorkflow support for PRF info-bench update before releasing of PO/SO

About this role:

In this role, you will be responsible for tunnel design strategy, RF requirement and technical solution evaluation to achieve cost effective tunnel coverage with good Quality of Service for SingTel Mobile’s 3G UMTS, 4G LTE and future wireless networks.
It will be essential for you to coordinate and maintain close inter-working relationships with external customers, suppliers as well as different departments in SingTel Mobile.

Key Responsibilities:
To perform tunnel design strategy and derive RF requirement for various tunnel projects.
To support Project Managers in technical RF scope of work and perform technical evaluation for new and existing tunnel projects.
To evaluate and review tunnel design proposal from vendor and conduct tender evaluation and clarification.
To plan for tunnel mobile coverage and capacity enhancement.
To support in vetting tender documents for RF-design and Acceptance criteria.
Any other duties assigned by the Supervisor.

The ideal candidate should possess/ be:
Degree in Electrical and Electronics or equivalent
Class 3 driving licence is compulsory.
Well verse in tunnel design and technical evaluation would be preferred.
Strong knowledge of the 3G UMTS and 4G LTE radio technology will be an added advantage.
Self-motivated, good communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.
Strong analytical skill and ability to conduct cost/benefit analysis.

prepared by the Managing Agent before submitting to Senior Manager / Manager (Facilities) for approval.Check and ensure that the Managing Agent carries out the maintenance works and activities in all building M & E systems are properly maintained in a serviceable and operational condition at all times so as to maintain the committed service levels.Coordinate and conduct maintenance and shutdowns activities.Raise notification request to stakeholder/customer for HT/LT and other forms of servicing maintenance.To prepare and certify Service Orders and Service Entries on time for works done and ensure prompt certification of works completion by the Managing Agent.Assist Senior Manager / Manager (Facilities) in preparing annual operation and capital budgets.Monitor operation and capital expenditures and explain any variances and ensure that accruals for expenditures are done on time for works done.Conduct regular audits to ensure that the Managing Agent keeps proper financial records of all transactions.Assist the Senior Manager / Manager (Facilities) with the review of fire-safety programmes, fire evacuation plan etc.. prepared by the Managing Agent’s Fire Safety Manager FSM.Ensure that the Managing Agent conducts proper handing / taking over of tenanted premises.Coordinate with the Managing Agent to enforce Tenants’ covenants stipulated in the lease agreements, such Group Enterprise 5G technology team is seeking for a hands-on network engineer, who will be part of the software development team of the Group Enterprise 5G product house, contributing on the design and implementation for Singtel edge and private cloud. In this position you will work with the 5G product team, to:

Key Responsibilities:
Design a multi-data center edge cloud network including the design of switches, routers and firewall.
Understand CIS and IM8 requirements for data centers and private cloud end to end and ensure compliance in the design.
Design the security in transportation and routing layer with firewalls and software defined security measures to protect the private datacenter environments.
Design fault resilience by planning dual path for all inter and intra data center communications.
Manage overall system health and IPMI of servers.
Qualify and select the right switches, routers and firewall for private data center setup and expansion.
Ensure sound and compliant design
Lead and drive the technical design.
Understand L2 and L3 networking and design the best routing plan for the private data center.
Understand protocols like NAT, BGP, OSPF for designing an optimal routing setup foro the private data center.
Own entire Network Architecture Design.
Be a team player
Be involved in implementation planning, detail design development, as well as UAT/SAT document development

The ideal candidate should possess:
Industry-related experience as a Network Engineer
Professional certification (e.g. CCNA, CCNP, CCIE)
Background in network administration and architecture
Familiar with campus/building networks and datacentre environment
Enterprise Network setup and configuration
Practical experience in configuring routers/switches/firewalls
Good understanding of Firewall rules configuration and security settings
Fine-tuning, problem troubleshooting, interpretation of statistics and traffic patterns
Experienced with Structured Cabling (UTP / Fiber)
In-depth understanding of communication protocols (mainly TCP/IP) and routing protocols (BGP, OSPF)
Knowledge in VLAN, VXLAN technologies, VPN protocols (OpenVPN, WireGuard)
Knowledge in SDN/Overlay Networking, Openflow/OVSDB
Able to maintain documentation, diagrams to any changes to the environments and Upto date SOPs
Good understanding of network operating systems
Familiar with network tools for administration, maintenance, automation, and visualization/reporting
Able to participate in the planning, configuration and deployment of client network environment
Experience with server’s hardware for HP Blade, VC, SIM, RX integrity series will be advantage
Experience with enterprise storage and SANs storage and EMC Powerpath will be advantage
Knowledge in Cloud technologies will be an advantage

System Operations

Being the business owner of several dedicated systems, the Executive will work with the Supervisor/Team Leader in managing vendor and IT Departments to ensure reliable performance from the systems
End-to-end management of all incidents initiated from operations and order fallout escalations. Key role is to track, respond and to coordinate with IT and various stakeholders to resolve incidents in a timely manner
Devise, plan and execute improvement efforts, processes to resolve system issues etc.
Fault resolution – Ensure IT conduct root cause analysis and implement long term solution/preventive measures
Ensure adherence to IT security, audit policies and any matter related to governance and IT framework

Project Management/System Enhancement
The Executive will work closely with stakeholders in designing and conceptualizing new systems/system enhancements (IT skills not required) to deliver an effective and efficient system that meets users’ needs and management objectives. You will support/work with the respective managers in implementing the following:
Gather and scope requirements with requestors to develop user requirement document
Manage, support & ensure the solution delivers according to user change request specifications (including system design, features and functionalities)
Ensure end to end solutions were fully thought through with IT before requirement signoff
Clarify discrepancies and gaps found in Impact Analysis (IA) document
Develop/review test plan and test cases for system enhancement (change request)
Manage/conduct UAT to ensure all functionalities delivered accordingly to specifications as well as defect management
Bridge any gap detected between IT & request owners to find the optimal solution
Perform sanity test before production deployment to ensure software stability during wee hours or midnight
Manage implementation and post-implementation activities such as training, onsite support, conducting post-mortems, benefit analysis, incident monitoring till closure
Manage deliverable schedule & resource. Tracking the progress of all deliverables and provide regular updates to the request owners via emails or meetings
Produce documentation for all deliverables such user manual, solution designs, test plan/results, etc and deposit them in the correct depository
Requirement
Minimum Diploma in any discipline – preferably Business or IT related
Able to work with a minimal supervision
Able to perform & support testing during at wee hours or midnight or weekends
Good interpersonal skills and able to work in a team
Good oral and written communication skills. Ability to read and speak mandarin will be an added advantage
Possess positive attitude and customer-focus mindset in delivering deliverables
Possess challenger-spirit in handling assigned tasks & situations
Proficient in MS Office & Visio Applications

ABOUT SGUNITED TRAINEESHIPS
Singtel Group is partnering with WSG to offer SGUnited Traineeships to recent graduates, to equip them with work experience and boost their employability. We have a broad range of opportunities across business, corporate functions and ICT. These traineeships will equip you with practical work experience in our operations, with a blend of on-the-job training and e-learning through our digital platform, #CURIOUS, which features >150,000 virtual learning courses.

More information on the program can be found under www.wsg.gov.sg/SGUnitedTraineeships-Trainees.html

NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. It is headquartered in Singapore and a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group.
NCS has in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions.
We deliver end-to-end ICT solutions to help governments and enterprises realise business value through digital transformation and the innovative use of technology.

Traineeship Description:
This position works with various stakeholders and is responsible for installing, diagnosing, maintaining, and upgrading all hardware and equipment

Skills and Competencies to learn:
To gain hands-on experience on Basic Configuration and Networking for End User Computing Devices, Installation of patches (including OS, software and security) etc.Engage stakeholders professionally and in a timely manner

This role is for all Singaporeans or PRs, who graduated from ITE, Polytechnics, Universities and other private institutions in 2019/2020. Those who completed National Service in 2019/2020 are also welcomed to apply!

Note to Recruitment Agencies
In sourcing for candidates for particular roles, the Singtel Group works only with a panel of selected recruitment agencies expressly engaged under written agreements. Even then, these agencies are only activated from time to time for specific recruitment exercises for particular roles under instructions expressly issued by a member of the Singtel Talent Acquisition team.
Except under such circumstances, no agency shall source or attempt to source any candidates for the Singtel Group. The Singtel Group will not pay nor be obliged or liable to pay any recruitment fees of any kind whatsoever to any agency where candidate CVs are submitted to the Singtel Group by such agency on an unsolicited or speculative basis.
The Singtel Group reserves all rights to directly contact any candidate to which such CVs relate without any obligation or liability whatsoever to the agency concerned (including without limitation any obligation or liability to pay any recruitment fees of any kind).

Designation : Sales Operations Officer, Asia
 Global Cyber Security
Salary : $2,000 to $2,500
Hire Type : 6 months contracts under recruitment agency payroll
Reporting Officer: Sales Operations Director, Asia

Description of Role:
The primary purpose of the position is to support the Sales Operations Department. This include but are not limited to order raising, billing and payment escalations.

Typical duties include:
Ensure timely and accurate day to day order rising, order closing and billings across various entities that Cyber is supporting.
Work closely with Sales Specialists and Account Management team for order raising, and order closing related matters.
Work closely with Product on customized orders processing and providing recommendations where available.
Support order provisioning for SME orders.
Support the team in terms of escalations investigations, coordinate with internal stakeholders to expedite order processing, delivery, order closure and billing.

Requirements:
Fresh A levels or 1-2 years working experience
Must have eye for details and ability to multitask
Independent, good time management and sensitive to numbers
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to work with all levels
